page.discussion: The *[xb:a5_scale_imagefile]* function scales an image file. The following image types are supported: .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .bmp.
page.prototype: V a5_scale_imageFile(C filenameIn ,C filenameOut ,N scale [,N maxSize [,C units [,C appliesto [,C scaleMethod [,N width [,N height [,L flagOKToUseImageMagic ]]]]]]])

argument.name: filenameIn
argument.description: Name of image file to scale.

argument.name: scale
argument.description: A decimal number to scale the image. E.g. 0.5 = 50% of original size, 1.5 = 150% of original size. If scale is set t 0, you can specify the maxSize.

argument.name: maxSize
argument.description: Default = 0. The dimension in inches or pixels of the height, width, or maximum dimention of the image. If size is 0, you can specify the maxSize property.

argument.name: units
argument.description: Default = "inches". Defines the dimension unit for the maxSize property. Can be "*[xb:inches]*" or "*[xb:pixels]*".

argument.name: appliesto
argument.description: Default = "Max". The dimension the maxSize is applied. appliesto can have a value of "*[xb:Width]*" (maxSize is applied to the image width), "*[xb:Height]*" (maxSize is applied to the image height), or "*[xb:Max]*" (maxSize is applied to larger of width and height.)
